intro: Lastrea furcata, commonly known as the forked lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in horticultural settings.
